Name: Rust, Sword and the Sun
QuestDesc: While waiting for contact from the Ephor's Palace, you and Abby arrive at Solis Tavern, where you run into a blind wandering bard—Nestor. Having learned of the Ephor's invitation to the hunt, Nestor shares with you Augusta's stories before she rose to power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Abby arrive at Solis Tavern. While waiting for contact from the Ephor's Palace, you run into a blind wandering bard, Nestor. He shares with you Augusta's stories before she rose to power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, muggy day... Sky's gloomy, air's all wet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, man! At least let me finish my sentence!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brrr... cold, cold, cold...

Options.PlotLineKey: A hot meal should warm you right up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh right, I'm famished! We barely had a bite sprinting all the way here from Ragunna...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, pinch me! This is a feast and a half!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}... so, uh... we did bring enough money, right? I mean, we kinda rushed out without grabbing anything...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that... don't worry, money's not an issue.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta made sure we're covered. All our food and lodging here in Septimont is billed straight to the Ephor's Palace.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think the owner might've overdone it a little...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah, better get used to it. You're the champ of the Great Agon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you know me. If food's on offer, I'll be a scoffer. No leftovers, guaranteed!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmmf, yum yum...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Free stay, free meal... This Ephor really knows how to treat guests. Maybe we should, you know, hang around a bit longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sniffs) This smells amazing!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, what do you think Imperator wants me to find? If Cartethyia's right, the last clues should be somewhere on the <te href=851028>Sanguis Plateaus</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're so close to the finish line, just one step away. But our pace has slowed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Hiccups) Relax! We're already back in Septimont, what's the rush?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember Lupa said there's this weird Blightcloud hanging over the Sanguis Plateaus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when the "High Tide" or whatever rolls around, all the Gladiators go there to hunt Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, is the High Tide coming up soon? The Ephor's invite did say something about a big hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh... that reminds me, aren't we supposed to meet her today?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A messenger came this morning. Augusta is dealing with an emergency, so our meeting's postponed... looks like it'll be a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unexpected change. It's throwing everything off course... I don't like the feel of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And why me for this hunt? If it's about the Great Agon... the messenger said none of the other Gladiators were invited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who knows? Maybe she just wants to test her strength against you. Typical Septimontian, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think so?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only met her a few times, but I doubt she acts on such simple impulses.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And as the Ephor, is she really in a position to do whatever she wants?
Guest from afar, you possess eyes as clear as crystal.
But... what troubles you so, that eyes once bright as the highland sky now darken with rolling clouds.
...A warrior who walks the blade's edge does not falter over trifles.
The clouds, if I may guess, are cast from the throne...
At the peak of Capitoline Hill, beneath the pale walls of the Ephor's Palace... secrets lie buried. And the most intricate among them are those born from the pursuit of power.
Even one as honorable as the Ephor must learn when to be ruthless.
In Septimont, a city forged in iron and blood, anyone who seeks the throne without knowing the cost is no better than a lamb marching to the butcher's knife.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Nestor, a traveling poet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rains in Septimont never seem eager to leave this season. So then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you are curious about the Ephor... then allow me to say that nothing would honor me more than to offer even a modest service to the Champion of the Great Agon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, how do you know {PlayerName} is the Champion? And all that stuff about the Ephor, too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Your eyes... hmm... Were we talking too loud?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To see and to hear are but two of the many ways to perceive. Trusting the senses is a habit, a natural expedience, but not the only option.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Truth be told, I've been gathering inspiration for my next epic, and its protagonist is none other than Augusta, the Ephor of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I speak of her with some familiarity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a feeling your tale with her will soon be written. And knowing more about those who walk alongside you is rarely without its benefits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta—

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A girl of humble birth, a Resonator of modest talent, a commoner without noble patronage. And yet from the den of wolves that is Septimont City, she rose, and eventually claimed her place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like the burning sun was once a cloud of dust.

Chapters.Title: Talk with Nestor and learn about the Ephor's story

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fail enough times, and you might eventually succeed. Should we call it resilience, or mere stubbornness?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or perhaps, for a girl who has lost everything, there was never a second option. She had no one to trust but herself, and naught but a blade to hold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the first stanza of an epic, this is nothing extraordinary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since the Lament, across the scorched lands of Solaris, I've heard this story repeat itself again and again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greatness, yes, our era has certainly seen it. But true greatness is never found on the first page of a story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Courage, glory, and honor... such immortal virtues have been etched in tablet and stone. They are never forged overnight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Light as a thread, elusive as the wind, they weave themselves into every twist of fate, tangling with every "insignificant" choice we make.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know, it's just unbelievable. The Augusta he's talking about and the Ephor we saw in the arena... No way they're the same person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, a girl far from home, arriving in the city upon Capitoline Hill in pursuit of strength. No title, no status, no wealth...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I doubt anyone at the time could've imagined her rising to where she is now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you mean... Cato?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you believe Cato handed her that final victory on purpose, and that his scathing words were a test of her resolve?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe he had long grown tired of that corrupt system.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then Cato must've been an idealist, to place his faith in a girl with nothing to her name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, why don't we keep this question in mind and see where the story leads us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready to listen to the "Epic of the Blazing Sun"?

Options.PlotLineKey: Listen to the "Epic of the Blazing Sun."

Chapters.Title: Continue chatting with Nestor, and learn about the Ephor's story

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nestor has told you everything he knows, yet his stories barely scratch the surface of Augusta's life. In the end, Nestor poses his questions: What is it that has lifted Augusta to the seat of power? What is it that makes a ruler? He expects no quick answers, but hopes you will meet Augusta with these questions in mind and seek the answers yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Merely the rough shape of a short epic. This is all I can offer about the Ephor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, as a listener, what do you make of my narration?

Options.PlotLineKey: I still don't know the Ephor enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I appreciate your kind words, my generous listener.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am only a humble wordsmith spinning verses and rhymes. The essence of poetry is granted by those who dare defy their fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there is one thing I must confess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through my words, your knowledge of the Ephor is... partial, at best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unembellished opinion. I appreciate your honesty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the tale is bland... then perhaps my heart hasn't yet aligned with her noble soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...May the ever-burning sun cast away my doubts, and wake my dusty mind from its slumber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But putting uninspired rhetoric aside, I still have one thing to confess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is, through my words, your knowledge of the Ephor remains, at best, incomplete.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this, you are right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Poetry can only offer a glimpse of the true story. The reality of people, events, and things slips beyond the grasp of words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do not belong in the pages of the epic, so I remain confined to the observer's gaze. I can imagine events and emotions unfold, but I cannot truly recreate them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's some advice for you, though I hesitate to call it such...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want the truth of a story, step into it. Become part of it. The opportunity stands before you now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I've said, the tale between you and Augusta, the hero of Septimont, is only now turning its next page.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem to know exactly what I'm about to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not difficult to see. Fate flows like the stars tracing their course. Your destination is written in the steps you take.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rain is passing... I hear it ceasing its symphony upon the earth. It is time for farewells.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before I leave, may I ask you one last question? What is it that has lifted Augusta to the seat of power? What is it that makes a ruler?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... I'd say strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's be real. There's no way Augusta could've passed those trials without strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, what do you think?

Options.PlotLineKey: It was born from the hardship of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you needn't rush to answer now. Keep it in mind as you continue your journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the final chapter is written, the answer will reveal itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell, my friend. Our paths crossed by fate and by chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon after this brief encounter, everything about me will be gone with the wind. But you... your epic continues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ephor's Palace rings with the Senators' criticisms toward Priestess Iuno as usual. After addressing their complaints, Augusta meets with the center of the grievances herself on the Palace roof. Iuno has some reservations about the upcoming hunting operation and their plans due to the prophecy she saw, but Augusta assures her firmly that she will fight to the very end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The previous day...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Excellency, you have indulged her too much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shrewd Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the Priestess, Iuno is far too unruly in both action and word. It's a disgrace to her title.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. She entered the Palace unannounced, uninvited, and with no decorum.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stern Senator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A blatant affront to the authority of the Palace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... same as always.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Senators, all she crossed was a doorway. One too insignificant to carry the weight of our authority, or defend anyone's fragile pride.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us not forget, it is not the walls of Capitoline Hill that command fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is my will, my sword, and our relentless conquest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know your fear. You fear a Priestess's voice drowning yours, and a rebel challenging the Senate's rules.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But listen well, power does not bow to sycophants cowering behind their traditions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you seek power, then step from the shadows. Face me and prove yourself worthy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Took you long enough, Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Handling the senators takes time. You know that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, to keep our esteemed Priestess from waiting, maybe next time I'll just leave them to their own devices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll make sure they record every detail of your "feat" and relay it word-for-word to Grandmother <te href=851017>Lillibet</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Priestess Iuno: Unruly behavior, left Tetragon Temple without permission and trespassed into the Ephor's Palace."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I wonder, who will lose it first, Lillibet or you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let those old foxes report me all they want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If they step into the Tetragon left foot first, I'll shoot the left. Right foot first? I'll shoot the right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, I'm with you on that one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Senate should be reminded now and then that the Tetragon's kindness is not a reason to take Priestess Iuno lightly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why didn't you wait there? I had everything handled. We depart for the hunting ground tonight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anything changed, you could've reached me by my Terminal. You didn't need to come all the way here... I want you free of duty until that day arrives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're overthinking it, Augusta. I'm here to see that person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandmother Lillibet said {Male=his;Female=her} fate is one of "unknowable void." Sounds intriguing enough to make time for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that's it. Too bad. The ship from Ragunna won't dock until tomorrow morning, and we'll be gone by then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, what a hassle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Patience, Iuno. {PlayerName} has accepted the invitation, so you'll have plenty of time to meet during the hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there something else you want to say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I read Grandma Lillibet's Book of Prophecies. The hunt and our plan... neither end well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you sure... we should go through with this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Risk does not trouble me. Peril simply requires greater strength. But really, when did you start caring about the Temple's traditions?

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "O ye faithless of Septimont, the Divinity is enraged. Should your ruler defy Their will again, doom shall be your fate."

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lately I've been hearing murmurs from the nobles again, about the ancient prophecy from Ragunna...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will admit, those words once carried weight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when our ancestors crossed the waters and climbed these hills, Ragunna's "Divinity" didn't get a seat on the ship.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Priestesses all said the prophecy was incomplete.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Only the <te href=851019>Hero of Heroes</te> wielding extraordinary power, risen from the dark tides, shall bring eternity to Septimont. Then shall the waters quiet, the tempest still, and glory return with the blood of the old king."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do not forget, this is the other half of the prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fabius, Atilius, Valeria... One after another, these heroes have saved Septimont from the brink of ruin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as a hero stands, no disaster can break this eternal city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if… this time is different? What if ruin is our fate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I will sever that fate with my blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's so amusing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the fearless Priestess Iuno can be frightened after all...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's fine. If you're afraid, don't push yourself. I can handle this alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most Revered Priestess, wait for me in the Temple. I shall return victorious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Frightened? Me? If anything, it's you, trying to shut me out and face it alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine. Go ahead. You'll come back to me sooner or later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That, I can't deny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! I knew it. So you do need me for this hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Iuno.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Why are you saying this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The storm is coming...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, Iuno, my friend. The best way to greet a storm... is to walk straight into it.
